Merge pull request #10421 from awels/add_request_limit_vm_export-b

[release-0.59] Add request and limits to vm export pod

Updated for 0.59 not being able to modify the values
throught the kubevirt config.

Signed-off-by: Alexander Wels <awels@redhat.com>

Allow setting of requests/limits on VMExport pod

Currently the VMExport pod won't start inside a namespace with a
quota. It will also not work inside a namespace with a specific limit
range ratio. This commit allows one to specify the requests and limits
of the VMExport pod, and it adds some defaults so it will work inside
a namespace with a quota.

Signed-off-by: Alexander Wels <awels@redhat.com>

Merge pull request #9977 from kubevirt-bot/cherry-pick-9963-to-release-0.59

[release-0.59] [e2e] Improve events deletion in AfterEach

Improve events deletion in AfterEach

Currently, we are deleting every events in a namespace after each test.
The way we are doing this increased the runtime of the e2e lanes
by a considerable amount.
Let's use delete collection instead of retrieving the events and delete one by one.

Signed-off-by: fossedihelm <ffossemo@redhat.com>

Merge pull request #9941 from acardace/backport-9722-0.59

[release-0.59] enable live migration with dedicated cpus and isolated emulator thread

enable live migration with dedicated cpus and isolated emulator thread

Blocking live migration with isolated emulator thread was introduced
due to a misunderstanding: there is nothing that prevents a VM, with
isolated emulator thread, to be live migrated (since the
VM configuration, including emulator thread isolation, happens at
VM initialization time).

Signed-off-by: Marcelo Tosatti <mtosatti@redhat.com>

Merge pull request #9881 from kubevirt-bot/cherry-pick-9874-to-release-0.59

[release-0.59] Add missing error check to test

tests: add testcase for kvm-pit thread affinity

Check if kvm-pit thread CPU affinity matches the affinity
of vcpu-0.

Signed-off-by: Marcelo Tosatti <mtosatti@redhat.com>

virt-handler: affine kvm-pit thread to vcpu0 thread

On installations that require timely injection of PIT timer
interrupts, we would not like to have the kvm-pit kernel thread
sharing CPU with Kubernetes processes (such as kubelet).

So affine the kvm-pit kernel thread to the same CPU as vcpu0,
when dedicated CPUs is enabled.

Signed-off-by: Marcelo Tosatti <mtosatti@redhat.com>

Add missing error check to test

Signed-off-by: Maya Rashish <mrashish@redhat.com>

Merge pull request #9825 from kubevirt-bot/cherry-pick-9591-to-release-0.59

[release-0.59] Improve mountinfo filtering for hotplugging NFS disks

Get fast migration when resourceQuota is updated
If migration was rejected by ResourceQuota than
We would want fast reaction time after updating
The Quota roles.

Signed-off-by: bmordeha <bmodeha@redhat.com>

Add functional test for new condition
Migration should contain condition when migrating with quota
that doesn't have resources for both source and target.

Signed-off-by: bmordeha <bmodeha@redhat.com>

Add condition that indicates that migration was rejected by RQ

Signed-off-by: bmordeha <bmodeha@redhat.com>

Added unit tests to verify nfs4 matches and that if multiple match the filter, the longest root is selected per the sort of the length of the root Changed check from exact nfs4 to prefix nfs to handle other possible nfs versions

Signed-off-by: Alexander Wels <awels@redhat.com>

Improve mountinfo filtering for NFS disks

When a VM was running multiple NFS disks (one boot disk)
and one hotplugged disk. The mount filtering was returning
multiple possible mounts on the host, and sorting on the
length of the 'root' path of the mount. For NFS these are
the same (/). This caused the wrong NFS mount to be picked
when hotplugging and an attempt was made to hotplug the boot
disk. This commit improves the situation by passing the 'source'
field to the filter, and it filters out entries that don't have
matching sources. This allows us to find the correct mount on
the host.

Signed-off-by: Alexander Wels <awels@redhat.com>

Merge pull request #9743 from kubevirt-bot/cherry-pick-9392-to-release-0.59

[release-0.59] Add virtctl vmexport manifest option

e2e: Remove events in the namespace after each test

Events are never deleted; they will be only at the end of the entire
suite execution, during namespace deletion.
Events cardinality can be very high, delaying the namespace deletion.
Since events scope ends at the end of each test we can remove them
during namespace cleanup.

Signed-off-by: fossedihelm <ffossemo@redhat.com>

Addressed more code review comments

Added extra descript on --service-url
Cleaned up some duplicate code

Signed-off-by: Alexander Wels <awels@redhat.com>

Changed manifest command to flag for download. Modified download to work without output flag and instead write to stdout. Fixed code review comments Changed a few functional tests to use port forward in case of downloading disk images.

Signed-off-by: Alexander Wels <awels@redhat.com>

Add virtctl vmexport manifest option

Allow virtctl to retrieve the manifests from the
VMExport status URLs

Signed-off-by: Alexander Wels <awels@redhat.com>

Merge pull request #9706 from 0xFelix/bug-9261-release-0.59

[release-0.59] instancetype: Handle VirtualMachineInstancetypeSpecRevision without APIVersion

instancetype: Handle VirtualMachineInstancetypeSpecRevision without APIVersion

As set out in issue #9261 there have been reports of older
VirtualMachineInstancetypeSpecRevision objects being stored in
ControllerRevisions without APIVersion set. This is likely due to a
known client-go issue [1] stripping TypeMeta from returned objects.

Given the limited support for v1alpha1 and the fact that we moved away
from VirtualMachineInstancetypeSpecRevision to complete objects being
captured in ControllerRevisions by v1alpah2 this change simply works
around this issue by ignoring the value of APIVersion. This should allow
the conversion to complete correctly until we upgrade these
ControllerRevisions in the future.

[1] https://github.com/kubernetes/client-go/issues/541

Conflicts:
  pkg/instancetype/instancetype_test.go

NOTE:
The conflict was due to refactorings that were not applied to this
branch. (e.g. renaming of variables)

Co-authored-by: Felix Matouschek <fmatouschek@redhat.com>
Signed-off-by: Lee Yarwood <lyarwood@redhat.com>

instancetype: Add regression test for bug #9261

Conflicts:
  pkg/instancetype/instancetype_test.go

NOTE:
The conflict was due to refactorings that were not applied to this
branch. (e.g. renaming of variables)

Co-authored-by: Felix Matouschek <fmatouschek@redhat.com>
Signed-off-by: Lee Yarwood <lyarwood@redhat.com>

Merge pull request #9655 from jean-edouard/release-0.59-fixpolicyinstall

[release-0.59] SELinux policy: ensure it never gets installed if the feature gate is set

Merge pull request #9660 from kubevirt-bot/cherry-pick-9640-to-release-0.59

[release-0.59] TSC frequencies: add 250PPM tolerance

TSC frequencies: add 250PPM tolerance

It is possible to migrate VMs to nodes that have a TSC frequency within 250PPM of theirs.
This adds support for it by tagging nodes with VMI frequencies within the tolerance range.

Signed-off-by: Jed Lejosne <jed@redhat.com>

SELinux policy: ensure it never gets installed if the feature gate is set

Most of the virt-handler callbacks are setup before refreshing the cache.
Also, callbacks are called once on setup.
It means that on first time, callbacks get called with mostly unpopulated objects,
including a crucially empty set of feature gates.
Since the SELinux policy feature gate is of the "disable" type,
the policy is then considered enabled and therefore gets installed.

Adding the callback after the cache refresh fixes the issue.

Signed-off-by: Jed Lejosne <jed@redhat.com>
(cherry picked from commit e99b4fcc9846f87f66e6efa4611c3d8846c2107e)
Signed-off-by: Jed Lejosne <jed@redhat.com>

Merge pull request #9644 from kubevirt-bot/cherry-pick-9638-to-release-0.59

[release-0.59] [virt-operator]: Fix kubevirt version parsing when custom operator image name provided

virt-operator: fix kubevirt version parsing

Kubevirt upgrade process can be tracked by watching the Kubevirt CR status conditions.
However anotherway to track it is to wait for the `KUBEVIRT_VERSION` value to be equal
to `status.observedKubevirtVersion` in the Kubevirt CR. We've found that the
`status.observedKubevirtVersion` dissapears from the status when providing virt-operator
image name that not ends explicitly with `virt-operator` suffix
(`virt-operator-1` for example).

The suggested change fallbacks the kubevirt version
to `KUBEVIRT_VERSION` env var, and in case the var is not set, it simply fallbacks to `latest`.

Signed-off-by: enp0s3 <ibezukh@redhat.com>

Merge pull request #9625 from kubevirt-bot/cherry-pick-9619-to-release-0.59

[release-0.59] [LimitRange tests]: Fix cleanup of LimitRange

Signed-off-by: Alex Kalenyuk <akalenyu@redhat.com>

Fix cleanup of limitrange

Signed-off-by: Alex Kalenyuk <akalenyu@redhat.com>

Refactor operator strategy

Split code related to strategy to separate
files

Signed-off-by: L. Pivarc <lpivarc@redhat.com>

Operator: Remove install strategy cache map

Keep the latest used install strategy.

The current cache behavior is to cache every
install strategy and only clear the cache when
Kubevirt is uninstalled.

This is increasing memory consumption with every change
to Kubevirt CR and ultimately lead to oom.

Signed-off-by: L. Pivarc <lpivarc@redhat.com>

there was an issue when virt-operator image had digest
instead of a tag, the hardcoded "latest" tag was used and

this commit fixes this issue by taking the Kubevirt version from
the KUBEVIRT_VERSION env var in case digest is used instead of tag.

(cherry picked from commit f4a4fa3afbd9a4a256228899b63f09b2977df6e4)

This results in `k get all -n <namespace>` returning those cluster-scoped resources.
```bash
$ oc get all -n openshift-config
Warning: kubevirt.io/v1 VirtualMachineInstancePresets is now deprecated and will be removed in v2.
NAME                                                                                AGE
virtualmachineclusterinstancetype.instancetype.kubevirt.io/cx1.2xlarge              5d22h
virtualmachineclusterinstancetype.instancetype.kubevirt.io/cx1.4xlarge              5d22h
```

Signed-off-by: Alex Kalenyuk <akalenyu@redhat.com>

Merge pull request #9534 from lyarwood/release-0.59-bug-9438

[release-0.59] webhooks: Return early when VirtualMachine is being deleted

tests: Add functional coverage of bug #9438

This change also reworks the original VirtualMachineControllerFinalizer
tests removing a duplicate creation test that was also asserted by the
removal test.

NOTE(lyarwood): Conflict caused by PR #9220 not being present on the
release-0.59 branch.

Conflicts:
  tests/vm_test.go

Signed-off-by: Lee Yarwood <lyarwood@redhat.com>
(cherry picked from commit 2f491cbc46518a11747ee809b80affceeb90e995)

webhooks: Return early when VirtualMachine is being deleted

As set out in issue #9438 previously attempts to remove a namespace
would be blocked if it contained VirtualMachines using
VirtualMachineInstancetypes. This was due to the update call to remove
the virtualMachineControllerFinalizer being rejected as the
ControllerRevision associated with the VirtualMachineInstancetype had
already been deleted, causing admission of the request to be rejected.

This change adds basic logic to both the mutation and admission webhooks
that returns early *if* the VirtualMachine is being deleted. Ensuring
the update to remove the virtualMachineControllerFinalizer is successful
and allowing the overall namespace removal to also complete.

Signed-off-by: Lee Yarwood <lyarwood@redhat.com>
(cherry picked from commit 0a39fc1c2b0b78fc73b2f61046e7d78b3fe1ece6)

Replace `HaveLen(0)` with `BeEmpty()`

This PR is a preperation for the next version of the ginkgolinter,
that will enforce this change.

Signed-off-by: Nahshon Unna-Tsameret <nunnatsa@redhat.com>
(cherry picked from commit b1aab057e2e473b90d217bcc322e7570d9e2a4e3)

[release-0.59] [virt-operator]: fix issue with retrieval of virt-component version

virt-operator: fix issue with retrieval of virt-component version

now that its possible to pass the name of a virt-component image to the operator
manifest using the VIRT_*_NAME env, its also possible to place a tag or digest
of the container as part of the name, for example:

 acme<dot>com/kubevirt/my-virt-handler@sha256:afafaf

In case a digest is in use, we would like to keep the functionality as
it was when the *_SHA_SUM vars were used per each virt-component
(this method is deprecated), thus when asking for component version,
the digest will be return, if used.

Signed-off-by: enp0s3 <ibezukh@redhat.com>

Merge pull request #9516 from orelmisan/0.59_spawnd_fix

[release-0.59] tests, console: Prevent NewExpecter negative timeout scenario

test: run serially the test using the scsi_debug modules

The tests using the functions CreateErrorDisk and CreateSCSIDisk uses
the scsi_debug module in order to create a scsi disk. However, the test
add and remove the kernel module, in order to avoid flakiness, the tests
needs to be run serially.

Signed-off-by: Alice Frosi <afrosi@redhat.com>

tests: clean-up persistent volumes

Persistent Volumes aren't namespaced, therefore they aren't
automatically cleaned-up at the end of the tests.

Signed-off-by: Alice Frosi <afrosi@redhat.com>

tests: remove test for IO error with faulty disks

In the storage test suite, there are 2 tests for verifing IO errors. One
of the two tests only checks that the VM is paused on an IO error, while
the second covers also the recovery from the error.

The removed test uses dmsetup to create a faulty disk and it was
introduced before relying on the scsi_debug module.

The 2 test creates flakiness as they both run in parallel and create a
local PV/PVC couple with the same storage class with the function
CreatePVandPVCwithFaultyDisk. For semplicity we can remove the simplest
test.

Signed-off-by: Alice Frosi <afrosi@redhat.com>

Quarantine flaky storage test that starts VMI with faulty disk

The following test has been impacting the storage test lanes over the
past two weeks:

`Storage Starting a VirtualMachineInstance with faulty disk [It] should
pause VMI on IO error`

As the impact has been greater than 5% over the past 14 days[1], this test
qualifies for quarantine.

This test may also be impacting another storage test[2] so quarantining
will allow to see if this helps to reduce the flakiness.

[1] https://search.ci.kubevirt.io/?search=Starting+a+VirtualMachineInstance+with+faulty+disk&maxAge=336h&context=1&type=build-log&name=&excludeName=&maxMatches=5&maxBytes=20971520&groupBy=job
[2] https://github.com/kubevirt/kubevirt/blob/main/tests/storage/storage.go#L159

Signed-off-by: Brian Carey <bcarey@redhat.com>

instancetype: Handle DataVolumeSourceRef without namespace when inferring defaults

As set out in issue #9431 it is valid for a DataVolumeSourceRef to not
provide a namespace, the assumption being that the resource it points to
is in the same namespace as the VirtualMachine.

This change handles this by switching to the namespace of the
VirtualMachine when no namespace is provided by the DataVolumeSourceRef,
avoiding a previous panic.

NOTE(lyarwood): conflict caused by
c09acad4db9cddf75c5b059d62c1074c40bd85ab not being present the in
release-0.59 branch.

Signed-off-by: Lee Yarwood <lyarwood@redhat.com>
(cherry picked from commit 50befd593b10b6a5c2a574f12ff9c6cbd6a9674d)

Merge pull request #9495 from kubevirt-bot/cherry-pick-9476-to-release-0.59

[release-0.59] Decrease portForward timeout when waiting config to be propagated

Fix pod expectation on migration

We need to reset the expectation
on PSA error to be able to retry
the migration.

Signed-off-by: L. Pivarc <lpivarc@redhat.com>

Fix seccomp profile test

The installation test of the custom seccomp profile acts like this:
1. delete previously profile in the virt-handler pod, if exists.
2. enable the feature gate in order to install the profile.
3. check if the profile exists in the virt-handler pod.

To enable the feature gate it is used the utility function
`tests.EnableFeatureGate(virtconfig.KubevirtSeccompProfile)`
The latter does not perform any update if the feature is already present.
Since the feature is enabled by default, this results in a non action, and
the profile deleted at point 1. will not be re-installed, causing the failure.
To effectively check that, once you add the feature gate, the profile is
installed, firstly delete the feature gate (if present), and then add it again

Signed-off-by: fossedihelm <ffossemo@redhat.com>

Make export via ingress test serial

Since this test runs in parallel to the route one, on OKD testing
we might end up picking the ingress object in the route test, and thus fail.

Signed-off-by: Alex Kalenyuk <akalenyu@redhat.com>

Decrease portForward timeout during WaitForConfigToBePropagatedToComponent

Currently, when we update the kubevirtCR (in serial tests or in AfterEach function),
we ensure that the config is propagated checking the revision number of the
components. To do this, we do a port forward to the pods.
This port-forward has a timeout of 10 seconds, and it is inside an Eventually
block with max duration of 10 seconds and 1 second of polling interval.
Since the next polling in the Eventually block does not start until the first one
is finished, we only try once to do the port-forward.
Let's try at least 2 times, decreasing the port-forward timeout to 5 seconds.

Signed-off-by: fossedihelm <ffossemo@redhat.com>

Merge pull request #9474 from kubevirt-bot/cherry-pick-9462-to-release-0.59

[release-0.59] tests: fix racy seccomp test

tests: fix racy seccomp test

Remove the custom profile before enabling the
feature-gate otherwise we might remove a newly
installed profile.

Signed-off-by: Antonio Cardace <acardace@redhat.com>

Signed-off-by: Alexander Wels <awels@redhat.com>

Fix vmrestore with WFFC snapshotable storage class

In case we had datavolumetemplates and the storage
class was WFFC we would wait for the DVs to become succeeded
although with WFFC they will never be.
Instead in case of WFFC we will let the restore complete.

Signed-off-by: Shelly Kagan <skagan@redhat.com>

[release-0.59] Add guest-to-request memory headroom ratio

Dont flood logs on sync guest time

Currently it may happen that we invoke
the sync operation too soon. (Read the domain
is actually not running on the target.) In this
case but also in some case of failure we flood
the logs with warnings.

This commits changes the verbosity of repeating
logs and make sure it is logged at the end.

Signed-off-by: L. Pivarc <lpivarc@redhat.com>

Tests: Headless service with migration

Signed-off-by: L. Pivarc <lpivarc@redhat.com>

Remove hostname limitation for migrations

For a long time Libvirt was using hostname
to perform check if it performs migration
from&to the same node. This check was dropped
or rather it is implemented in another way
since 6799b72d927015db4ce4cab879f072abc91a41ae 2020.

Therefore we can drop this limitation and actually
address long standing bug with services.

Signed-off-by: L. Pivarc <lpivarc@redhat.com>

Check the length of the host CPU models slice

Also, fix the warning, so it is printed when the number of models is
greater than one.

Signed-off-by: Vasiliy Ulyanov <vulyanov@suse.de>

Add unit-tests to cover the new labeling logic

Ensure the CPU model labels are added according to the supported set of
features on the node.

Signed-off-by: Vasiliy Ulyanov <vulyanov@suse.de>

Take CPU features into account when labeling nodes

Don't add labels with CPU models if the host does not support the
required features. Libvirt may still mark such models as 'usable' as
they can be used by qemu, however an attempt to run a VM on such a node
will fail since it will not pass validation (KubeVirt does not
explicitly disable the checking of CPU features for usable models):

    https://libvirt.org/formatdomaincaps.html#cpu-configuration

This handles scenarios when cpu_map expects features deprecated on
modern CPUs to be present:

    https://gitlab.com/libvirt/libvirt/-/issues/304

Signed-off-by: Vasiliy Ulyanov <vulyanov@suse.de>

Signed-off-by: Itamar Holder <iholder@redhat.com>

Add guest-to-request memory headroom to compute containers

Signed-off-by: Itamar Holder <iholder@redhat.com>

Add AdditionalGuestMemoryOverheadRatio to Kubevirt CR

AdditionalGuestMemoryOverheadRatio can be used to set a
ratio between VM's memory guest and the memory allocated
to the compute container. A higher ratio means that the
VMs would be less compromised by node pressures, but
would mean that fewer VMs could be scheduled to a node.
If not set, the default is 1.

Signed-off-by: Itamar Holder <iholder@redhat.com>

Merge pull request #9359 from kubevirt-bot/cherry-pick-9338-to-release-0.59

[release-0.59] [virt-controller] fix out-of-bound slice index in evacuation controller

Merge pull request #9354 from awels/set_hotplug_cpu_mem_ratio_to_1_059

[release-0.59] Set mem/cpu request and limits on hotplug attachment pod container to 1 to 1 ratio

fix out-of-bounds slice access in evacuation controller

There can be a case where there are no free spots but also
there are no migration candidates and no non-migratable VMs.
in such case the execution continues. This could lead to OOB
access, since the free spots counter can have a negative value.
A negative value can be reached if for example a user decides to lower
the configured maximum of allowed concurrent migrations per source node.
Thus the amount of active migrations can exceed the maximum and we get a
negative freeSpots

Signed-off-by: enp0s3 <ibezukh@redhat.com>

increase test coverage in evacuation controller unit tests

added a test which checks no-op from the controller when the
amount of active concurrent migrations exceeds the maximum allowed
this can happen when a user reduces the configured maximum during a drain

Signed-off-by: enp0s3 <ibezukh@redhat.com>

Should remove and restore labeller only from workers Currently in some tests we are waiting for the node labeller to be resumed in any nodes including unschedulable nodes and that will not work because master shouldn't be labeled by node labeller.

Signed-off-by: bmordeha <bmodeha@redhat.com>

Use ECDSA instead of RSA

Currently, kubevirt generates certificates with RSA signature.
ECDSA, in general, create signatures faster than RSA.
Also, OLM already uses ECDSA[1], and it would be right to conform.
The elliptic curve used is the NIST P-256 (FIPS 186-3, section D.2.3),
also known as secp256r1 or prime256v1: this is supported by TLS1.3[2].

[1] https://github.com/operator-framework/operator-lifecycle-manager/blob/master/pkg/controller/certs/certs.go#L31:L34
[2] https://www.rfc-editor.org/rfc/rfc8446#section-4.2.7

Signed-off-by: fossedihelm <ffossemo@redhat.com>
